Key Match Events: Rohit Sharma scored 57 runs off 39 balls including 4 fours and 2 sixes
Jofra Archer was dismissed lbw by Bumrah for 21 runs
Axar Patel took 3 wickets in his first three overs
Kuldeep Yadav took 3 wickets, including dismissing Sam Curran and Harry Brook
England was bowled out for 103 runs
Pre-Game Insights: India's batters scored an above-par total on a tough pitch
England planned to shut out half of the outfield to India but were partially unsuccessful
Tactical battle in tough conditions due to slow pace and low bounce
Rohit Sharma and Suryakumar Yadav put on a 73-run partnership for the third wicket
Post-Match Reflections: India's quest for a world title is well on course
It's been 11 years since India stood on the podium as champions
Rohit Sharma accepted that risk is a part of T20 cricket and there's no point being averse to it
England's captain was dismissed for 57 off 39 balls
England's last recognised batter, Livingstone, was run-out after a mix-up with the lower order
Miscellaneous Highlights: Runs square and behind the wicket came at a premium on a pitch like Guyana's
Adil Rashid was 2-0-17-0 in his first four overs
Shivam Dube was held back as India believed quicks would take over
Liam Livingstone finished with figures of 4-0-24-0
England's six batters made single-digit scores and none went past 25
